newsitem.title: USA: IntraNet sees higher Q3 revenues.
newsitem.headline: IntraNet sees higher Q3 revenues.

text.p: IntraNet Solutions Inc said Wednesday it expects to report revenues of about $6.1 million for its fiscal third quarter ended December 31, 1996, an increase of 60 percent over revenues of $3.8 million for the third quarter of 1995.
This also represents an increase of 50 percent over revenues of $4.1 million for its fiscal second quarter ended September 30, 1996.
The company said complete results for the third quarter will be released in February.

"Our business was very strong in the third quarter. The increase in revenues was driven both by growth from existing customers and by new business," said Robert Olson, chief executive officer of IntraNet Solutions, in a statement.

IntraNet also repeated it expects to operate at a loss for the balance of its fiscal year. "As we have previously announced, we expect to continue to operate at a loss for the quarter and the year ending March 31, 1997, as we invest in the facilities and infrastructure to support a much larger business in the future," he said.
IntraNet helps companies design and implement systems for managing and distributing business-critical information contained in documents within and outside the company.
